intro: Santiria longipaniculata, commonly known as the long panicle santonica, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in panicles. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Santiria longipaniculata is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
